about_the_game:
You and your "friends" have been hired by a mysterious delivery company with one simple task: deliver the package. But there's a catch. Only one of you can deliver it and claim the cash. The rest? Well, they’re just in the way.

Sabotage and Survive In this chaotic multiplayer game, you’ll use proximity VOIP to communicate and strategize with your friends... or just lie. Pick up anything you find along the way—rocks, bananas, or even more questionable objects—and sabotage your friends by any means necessary. Only one of you walks away with the paycheck.

Terrifying Bunker Runs These delivery locations aren’t your usual drop-offs. Procedurally generated bunkers filled with unsettling creatures are waiting to turn your job into a nightmare. Stay quiet, stay alert, and keep an eye on your "friends"—because the monsters aren’t the only threat lurking in the dark.

Take. Sell. Profit. Why just deliver the package when you can make some side cash? Collect valuable items along the way and sell them off for upgrades, traps, and more ways to make your "friends" miserable. The more you sabotage, the closer you get to that sweet payday.

name: Dead Dawg Delivery Co.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: 6-Core CPU
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1060 or RX 580
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: 6-Core CPU
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1060 or RX 580
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

short_description: Deliver the package, sabotage your friends, and avoid the horrors lurking in procedurally generated maps. Only one of you can claim the reward—everyone else is just in the way.
